intro: Struthanthus lewisii, commonly known as Lewis's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Struthanthus lewisii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
